column4: Hello people can anyone help me ? it's for the first time for me to install Unbuntu when I get to part 5 (the section to select a partition to install Ubuntu) the screen shows me that all my hard drive is a unallocated
judicata well yea I expected to see sda1 sda5 and 3 :)
is XP on the disk?
If you expected to see something else on your HD..that's bad news.
can you point to me somekind of link to see how can I resolve my problem or something
do you have XP on the drive?
yes on sda1 and I use sda5 for movies and games
you still here?
yes
so, do you have XP or another OS on the disk, and will that OS still boot?
yes I've XP
and will it boot?
and I guess the partitions are invisible if you just open up gparted from the live cd?
there are visible from gparted
but, not from the installer??
yes :(
so, you go to manually edit the partition table, and it shows that the whole thing is unallocated?
yeap that's right
but the partitions are visible when you open up gparted. So, just to make sure I understand, this means you haven't completed the installation process right?
sorry, hopefully someone else can figure this out.
hey dude it works now :)
are you here? :)
